Detailed Description

MGContext defines the attributes of a document.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MGContext::MGContext ( const MGSnapAttrib &  snap_attrib,
int  line_density,
const MGColor &  Bcolor,
const MGColor &  Gcolor,
const MGColor &  Hcolor,
float  smooth,
float  pick_aperture,
MGglViewAttrib *  views[4],
const double  torelance[6],
const mgTLInputParam &  tessellate_param,
MGAppearance *  appearance = 0 
)
Parameters:
snap_attrib Snap data
line_density line density for a surface to draw in wire mode.
Bcolor Background color.
Gcolor Object lines color.
Hcolor Object highlight color.
smooth Smoothness of the curves to draw. 1/smooth is the division number of a curve whose length is the window width. When smooth becomes small, smoothness increases.
pick_aperture Pick aperture. Number of pixels to allow picking.
views Newed objects of MGglViewAttrib, may be null. The ownership will be transfered to this MGContext. [0]=for 3D perspective view [1]=for (x,y) 2D view [2]=for (y,z) 2D view [3]=for (z,x) 2D view
torelance MGCL Tolerance. [0]=wc_zero; [1]=rc_zero; [2]=mach_zero; [3]=line_zero; [4]=angle_zero; [5]=max_knot_ratio;
tessellate_param tessellation parameter.
appearance must be a newed object of MGAppearance. the ownership will be transfered to this MGContext.

Execution of drawing OpenGL attributes.

Valid OpenGL rendering context must be made current.

Execution of rendering OpenGL attributes.

Valid OpenGL rendering context must be made current.

double MGContext::pick_aperture (  )  const [inline]

pick_aperture.

The pick_aperture data is used for MGOpenGLView. See the explanation.

pick_aperture.

The pick_aperture data is used for MGOpenGLView. See the explanation.

Parameters:
appearance appearance must be a newed object. The ownership will be transfered to this MGContext.

Parameters:
appearance appearance must be a newed object. The ownership will be transfered to this MGContext.
void MGContext::set_view ( MGglViewAttrib *  view,
int  view_num 
)

Set the view data of the view view_num.

Parameters:
view must be a newed object of MGglViewAttrib. the ownership will be transfered to this MGContext.
view_num Standard view number: 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
void MGContext::set_view_context ( int  view_num,
const MGOpenGLView &  view 
)

Set the viewing context of MGOpenGLView view to the document.

Parameters:
view_num Standard view number of the view. 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
double MGContext::smooth (  )  const [inline]

set/get smooth data.

The smooht data is used for MGOpenGLView. See the explanation. Smoothness of the curves to draw.

double MGContext::smooth (  )  const [inline]

set/get smooth data.

The smooht data is used for MGOpenGLView. See the explanation. Smoothness of the curves to draw.

const MGglViewAttrib* MGContext::view ( int  view_num  )  const

get MGglViewAttrib attrib data.

When view_num is not the number of a standard view, null will be returned.

Parameters:
view_num Standard view number of the view. 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
MGglViewAttrib* MGContext::view ( int  view_num  ) 
Parameters:
view_num Standard view number of the view. 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
